member.name: T:Bee.Core.DependencyKind
member.summary: Wether you want to express a to-build or a to-use dependency

member.name: F:Bee.Core.DependencyKind.ToBuild
member.summary: A ToBuild dependency is a dependency that must be produced before you can build a certain node. If we are able to retrieve a node from the cache server its to-build dependencies will not be built.

member.name: F:Bee.Core.DependencyKind.ToUse
member.summary: A ToUse dependency is a dependency that must be produced before this node is used/consumed/ran by something else. If we are able to retrieve this node from the cache server we will also build its to-use dependencies before building any node that uses this node. One example of a ToUse dependencies is a dll distributed next to an executable.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.Backend
member.summary: Interface for a build-graph construction backend.
member.remarks: Build code calls the methods on this interface to add elements to the build graph. Note that none of the actions are executed immediately upon being called; they are simply recorded into the build graph, to be executed later by the build backend.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddWriteTextAction(NiceIO.NPath,System.String,System.String,NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: Adds a "write text" action to the build graph, which, when executed during the build process, opens the given file, overwrites the contents of it with the provided text, then closes it again.
member.param: The file to write.
The string to replace the file contents with.
The name of this action in the buildgraph. Defaults to "WriteText" but you can specify a more meaningful name if you want.
To use ByLeafInput caching, generated files that #include non generated files need to specify in the buildgraph which non generated files they intend to include

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddCopyFileAction(NiceIO.NPath[],NiceIO.NPath[],System.String)
member.summary: Adds a "copy file" action to the build graph, which, when executed during the build process, will copy each given file from the 'sources' locations to the 'targets' locations. The number of sources and targets must match.
member.param: The paths to copy to.
The paths to copy from.
The name of this action in the buildgraph. Defaults to "CopyFile" but you can specify a more meaningful name if you want.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddDependency(NiceIO.NPath,NiceIO.NPath,Bee.Core.DependencyKind)
member.summary: Adds a dependency between two files in the graph.
member.param: The file that has the dependency.
The file that it is dependent on.
Flags to specify if this dependency is required when this node is built, or when it is used, or both.
member.remarks: The backend will ensure that the 'to' file is up-to-date before it begins building the 'from' file. However, note that this does not mean that rebuilding the 'to' file will also cause the 'from' file to be rebuilt; that will only happen if the 'to' file is actually recorded as an input to the 'from' file, rather than just a dependency.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddDependency(NiceIO.NPath,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{NiceIO.NPath},Bee.Core.DependencyKind)
member.summary: Adds a dependency from one file to multiple other files in the graph.
member.param: The file that has the dependency.
The files that it is dependent on.
Flags to specify if this dependency is required when this node is built, or when it is used, or both.
member.remarks: The backend will ensure that all of the 'to' files are up-to-date before it begins building the 'from' file. However, note that this does not mean that rebuilding any of the 'to' files will also cause the 'from' file to be rebuilt; that will only happen if the 'to' files are actually recorded as an inputs to the 'from' file, rather than just as a dependency.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.ScanCppFileForHeaders(NiceIO.NPath,NiceIO.NPath,NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: Configure a C++ file to be scanned for #include directives.
member.param: The path to the object file being created by compiling the C++ file.
The path to the C++ file being compiled.
The include directories that should be searched for headers.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.ScanInputsOfFileForCustomImplicitInputs(NiceIO.NPath,Bee.Core.CustomScannerInfo,NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: Configure custom implicit input scanning for a build action. It's similar to scanning for #includes, but allows you to find paths to files expressed in ways other than '#include' specifically.
member.param: An output file that identifies which action you're configuring.
The custom scanner properties for this action.
Once the scanner finds a path in the input files, it will be resolved relative to these base paths in an attempt to locate the actual file on disk.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddAliasDependency(System.String,NiceIO.NPath)
member.summary: Add a dependency between an 'alias', which is a symbolic name within the build graph, on one a particular file.
member.remarks: Aliases may be treated case insensitive by the backend. Adding an alias that differs only by casing is not allowed.
member.param: The alias that is having the dependency added.
The file that it is dependent on.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddAliasDependency(System.String,NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: Add a dependency between an 'alias', which is a symbolic name within the build graph, on one or more particular files.
member.remarks: Aliases may be treated case insensitive by the backend. Adding an alias that differs only by casing is not allowed.
member.param: The alias that is having the dependency added.
The files that it is dependent on.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddImplicitDependenciesToAllActionsWithInputsThatLiveIn(NiceIO.NPath,NiceIO.NPath)
member.summary: Register the given directory as generating an implicit dependency, such that all actions which have inputs inside the directory should automatically recieve a dependency on the given file.
member.param: The directory generating the dependency.
The file that should be added as a dependency to any actions with inputs in the directory.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Backend.AllDirectoriesProducingImplicitDependencies
member.summary: Get the list of all directories which are currently registered as producing implicit dependencies.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.RegisterGlobInfluencingGraph(NiceIO.NPath,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Register a directory which has been globbed during build graph generation, and therefore should be rechecked by the build backend in order to determine whether the build graph is out of date and should be rebuilt.
member.param: The directory in which globbing was performed.
One or more filter expressions for files in this directory which should be included in the glob. By default, null, which means all files in the directory will be considered.
If true, also consider files in subdirectories, recursively. Default is false.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.RegisterFileInfluencingGraph(NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: Register one or more files as having been used during build graph generation, and therefore should be checked by the build backend in order to determine whether the build graph is out of date and should be rebuilt.
member.param: The files that have been used during build graph generation.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.RegisterStatInfluencingGraph(NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: Register one or more paths as having been checked for existence, and therefore should be checked by the build backend in order to determine whether the build graph is out of date and should be rebuilt. This will only cause the buildprogram to rerun if a file that first did not exist now does exist. Unlike FileInfluencingGraph it does not care about contents
member.param: The files that have been used during build graph generation.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddAliasToAliasDependency(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a dependency between one 'alias', which is a symbolic name within the build graph, and another alias.
member.param: The alias that is having the dependency added.
The alias that it is dependent on.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddDependencyToAlias(NiceIO.NPath,System.String)
member.summary: Add a dependency from one generated file to an already existing alias.
member.param: The file whose generation needs to have a dependency on the specified alias.
The alias that it is dependent on.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Backend.CanHandleAnsiColors
member.summary: Returns whether this build backend can handle ANSI color codes in the output from executables.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddSharedResource(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a Shared Resource to the build graph. A Shared Resource is some supporting resource that is not itself a build action, but is required to support build actions, such as a compiler server. The resource will be created before any action that requires it is executed, and will be destroyed after all actions that require it have completed.
member.param: The name of the shared resource, such as "CscServer" or "MSPdbSrv". This is used when specifying the action, and will be displayed in messages emitted by the backend.
The command to perform when the resource is being created. This will happen at most once per build, and will not happen at all if no actions that require this resource are being executed.
The command to perform when the resource is being destroyed. This will happen after all actions that use this resource have completed executing; it will not happen if the resource was not created.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.HasAction(NiceIO.NPath)
member.summary: Use this to figure out if a certain file has been setup to be generated. Useful if you want to setup a dependency to it, as you can only setup dependencies to files that are generated.
member.param: The path you're interested in
member.returns: Wether or not that path has been a targetFile of an AddAction() command

member.summary: Adds an action to the build graph, which will be executed by running an external program.
member.param: The name of the action, such as "CompileC++". This, along with the first target file, will be used to identify the action in build output.
The files that will be output by this build action.
The files that will be used as inputs by this build action.
The command to launch the executable that performs this action. This should usually only be the path to the executable to run.
The arguments that should be passed to the executable, or packed into a response file, if this action supports response files and the arguments are long enough.
True if the executable supports response files using an @responsefile.rsp argument; false otherwise. Defaults to false.
Any custom environment variables that should be provided to the executable.
Paths to any pregenerated response files or command batch files.
If false, check that every line in the standard output contains one of the substrings in the allowedOutputSubstrings array, and fail the action if any lines do not. Defaults to true.
If false, require that all targetFiles have updated timestamps after the action is run, and fail the action otherwise. Defaults to false.
If true, require that all inputs be scanned by timestamp instead of by content digest. Defaults to true.
Multiline regular expression patterns to check for in the output. If one of the patterns matches, then the output will be swallowed.
Additional files created as side effects of our real target files. Useful for allowing Bee to clean up these files when the action that generates them is no longer present.
Directories that this action will write into. Use this if the tool produces outputs that you cannot antipiate ahead of time.
IDs of shared resources that this action requires to execute.

If true, when this action is being run, then its outputs should be deleted first; if false the outputs will be left on disk (and presumably overwritten). If null, this parameter will default to true when using targetDirectories, and false otherwise.
To use ByLeafInput caching, generated files that #include non generated files need to specify in the buildgraph which non generated files they intend to include
The caching mode for this node. You can specify leafinput caching for nodes that are valuable to cache because they are expensive to produce.
a list of inputs that while technically are inputs to use when calculating hashing keys should be ignored anyway. useful for files that store tihngs like revision information
The optional path at which this node will write a chrome://tracing style profiler output file
The splitting char to use when creating the response file. Defaults to space

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddCSharpAction``1(System.String,NiceIO.NPath[],NiceIO.NPath[],System.Action{Bee.Core.CSharpActionContext,``0},``0,NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: AddCSharpAction takes a c# delegate instead of an executablestring + arguments. The delegate is supposed to point to a static method, or a local static function. The signature of the function needs to be YourStaticMethod(NPath[] targets, NPath[] inputs, TArgument argument, NPath[] targetDirectories). You can choose TArgument to your liking. It can be as simple as a string, or a class with fields, or lists or arrays. As long as the ObjectsToDisk serializer can serialize it, you can use it.
member.param: annotation for the action
targetfiles for the action
inputs for the action
the delegate that points to the static method that holds the implementation of the action
the value of the argument you want to pass
the targetdirectories for this action
member.typeparam: the type of the argument this method takes

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.AddCSharpAction(System.String,NiceIO.NPath[],NiceIO.NPath[],System.Action{Bee.Core.CSharpActionContext},NiceIO.NPath[])
member.summary: AddCSharpAction takes a c# delegate instead of an executablestring + arguments. The delegate is supposed to point to a static method, or a local static function. The signature of the function needs to be YourStaticMethod(NPath[] targets, NPath[] inputs, TArgument argument, NPath[] targetDirectories). You can choose TArgument to your liking. It can be as simple as a string, or a class with fields, or lists or arrays. As long as the ObjectsToDisk serializer can serialize it, you can use it.
member.param: annotation for the action
targetfiles for the action
inputs for the action
the delegate that points to the static method that holds the implementation of the action
the targetdirectories for this action

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Backend.ConfigureCSharpActions(Bee.Tools.Shell.ExecuteArgs)
member.summary: Before using AddAction() with a csharp delegate as action, invoke this method to inform the backend of which commandline it should use to invoke a specific static method in a buildprogram.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.KeyedCollectionWithConditions`3
member.summary: Represents a collection of values applies to different keys, some of which should only be used in particular configurations.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.KeyedCollectionWithConditions`3.KeyValidator
member.summary: A validation function that is run on every key being added to the collection. Use this to check keys before they are added and potentially throw exceptions if they are invalid.
member.exception: The collection has already been added to. It is not permitted register a validator after values have been added.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.KeyedCollectionWithConditions`3.ValueValidator
member.summary: A validation function that is run on every value being added to the collection. Use this to check values before they are added and potentially throw exceptions if they are invalid.
member.exception: The collection has already been added to. It is not permitted register a validator after values have been added.

member.summary: Deployables will be put in this subdirectory

member.name: T:Bee.Core.OneOrMoreFiles
member.summary:
A class to that can represent one or more files. Its purpose is to allow globs (like Runtime/**/*.cpp), to not be immediately flattened into the resulting cpp files, but for us to be able to continue to persist the knowledge of that glob throughout the pipeline, so that later we can still use this information. Project file generation is a usecase that wants to know the original globs, as it allows to create project files that are more robust against changes-on-disk, since they won't have to be regenerated when a new .cpp file gets added, since when they use globs, that won't change the contents of the project file itself. This also allows the buildprogram to avoid executing the actual glob when it's producing the project file, which in turn means that the tundra buildgraph for the project files will have fewer GlobSignatures, so there will be a higher % of builds that we can satisfy by doing completely nothing, isntead of having to run the buildprogram to realize we have to do nothing.
In most usages of OneOrMoreFiles, you can just implicitely assign an NPath and don't worry about anything.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions`2
member.summary: Represents a collection of values, some of which should only be used in particular configurations.
member.typeparam: The type of value in the collection.
The type of the configuration object used to determine when values should or should not be used.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions`2.ValueValidator
member.summary: A validation function that is run on every value being added to the collection. Use this to check values before they are added and potentially throw exceptions if they are invalid.
member.exception: The collection has already been added to. It is not permitted register a validator after values have been added.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions`2.IsEmpty
member.summary: True if no values have been added to the collection (either conditionally or unconditionally).
member.remarks: Because values may be conditional, be aware that even when IsEmpty returns false, querying the collection with a specific configuration can still return an empty set of values. Also, note that querying this property does NOT count as reading from the collection.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions`2.For(`1)
member.summary: Returns the values to use for a given configuration. The configuration object is used both to check conditions on any conditional values, and also to compute values that are derived from the config directly.

member.returns: The values to use for this configuration.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions`2.CopyTo(Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions{`0,`1})
member.summary: Copy all values in this collection to another collection with the same type of value and configuration.
member.param: The collection to copy values to. The values in this collection will be appended to any existing values in the other collection.
member.exception: The target collection has already been read from. It is not permitted to modify a collection after it has been read.
member.remarks: Note that this will copy all unconditional and conditional values, but will not copy any values that are dynamically derived from the configuration.

member.typeparam: The configuration type used by the other collection.
member.param: The collection to copy values to. The values in this collection will be appended to any existing values in the other collection.
A function that maps configuration objects used by this collection, to configuration objects used by the other collection.
member.exception: The target collection has already been read from. It is not permitted to modify a collection after it has been read.
member.remarks: Note that this will copy all unconditional and conditional values, as well as values dynamically derived from the configuration.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.CollectionWithConditions`2.ForAny
member.summary: Returns all values that are used in any configuration. Note that this may include duplicate values, and it will not include values which are computed from the configuration.
member.returns: All values used in any configuration.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.RequirementsForRunningBuildCode
member.summary: Running buildcode that talks to bee api's requires certain global hooks to be set. This class is the one place that controls which things needs to be set and need to be cleaned up.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.BuildProgramFileSystem
member.summary:
A custom NPath filesystem implementation designed to be used for all bee build programs.
- Enforce the requirement that bee buildprograms should not be modifying the filesystem, only observing it, by making all write* methods throw an exception - Use that requirement to cache results of Directory.GetFiles() and Directory.GetCurrentDirectory(). - Allow bee to ask the filesystem which globs/filereads were executed by the buildprogram, so we can store that information in the generated .dag.json

member.name: T:Bee.Core.CustomScannerInfo
member.summary: Configuration for a 'custom' include scanner (i.e. for locating extra inputs to a build step using a syntax other than the standard C/C++ #include directives).

member.name: P:Bee.Core.CustomScannerInfo.Keywords
member.summary: List of keywords which indicate that the rest of the line contains the path to an implicit input. For a line to be considered, one of these keywords must be the first non-whitespace token on the line. The keywords themselves can contain whitespace if necessary.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.CustomScannerInfo.SearchRelativeToScannedFile
member.summary: If true, locate the files referenced by custom include expressions by searching relative to the file that included them. If false, the path must be relative to one of the formal include directories provided with the scanner.

member.summary: Create a StevedoreArtifact that is sourced from the 'testing' Stevedore repository.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.UnityInternal(System.String)
member.summary: Create a StevedoreArtifact that is sourced from the 'unity-internal' Stevedore repository.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.FromLocalFile(System.String,NiceIO.NPath)
member.summary: Creates a StevedoreArtifact that's already present locally in the repository, and thus should not be downloaded. Intended SOLELY as a transitional measure, allowing the Stevedore APIs to be used for existing largefiles until they're moved to a proper Stevedore server.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.IsByNameOnly
member.summary: StevedoreArtifacts can be created either by name only, or by a specific repo, name and version. IsByName lets you know which one was used.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.FromLocalPath
member.summary: The FromLocalPath of this StevedoreArtifact. Only query this property if you are sure this StevedoreArtifact was not created by name only.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.RepoName
member.summary: The RepoName of this StevedoreArtifact. Only query this property if you are sure this StevedoreArtifact was created with an RepoName.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.ArtifactId
member.summary: The ArtifactId of this StevedoreArtifact. Only query this property if you are sure this StevedoreArtifact was created with an ArtifactId.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.ArtifactName
member.summary: The ArtifactName of this StevedoreArtifact.

member.name: F:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact._path
member.summary: The base path that this artifact will be unpacked to. All access to files in the artifact should be constructed with this path as a base.

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.Path
member.summary: Returns a virtual path representing this stevedore artifact. It looks like /VirtualStevedoreRoot/public/roslyn-csc-win64/... and can be safely used through NPath and through Backend.Current

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.VersionString
member.summary: The 'version string' part of the artifact version (i.e. excluding the hash and file extension). Given an artifact ID like "myartifact/1.0.1_26ab72615c65d7e857f.7z", returns "1.0.1".

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.GetFileList
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all files in this artifact. Beware a number of issues with this extension to the core Stevedore system: - If the file list isn't already cached, it will be downloaded in the frontend, which happens synchronously on a single thread (like everything in the frontend). Using a lot of file lists can thus have a significant performance impact in poor network conditions (10 seconds per file list in the worst case). - These frontend downloads may encounter SSL certificate issues on certain .NET runtime and OS combinations (these issues do not occur for regular downloads in the backend). - Error handling is less polished in the frontend, and there's no telemetry data, which may make troubleshooting more difficult. - '.filelist' artifacts are not checksummed, and therefore carry an increased risk of file corruption on disk or in transit.
member.returns: A list of all file paths in the artifact. The paths include the full base path so you can use them directly.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.#ctor(Bee.Stevedore.Program.RepoName,Bee.Stevedore.Program.ArtifactId)
member.summary: Create a StevedoreArtifact with the specified repository name and artifact ID. Manifests files (if used) may override the repository and artifact version.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.#ctor(Bee.Stevedore.Program.ArtifactName)
member.summary: Create a StevedoreArtifact by looking up the given name in the manifest file(s).

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a StevedoreArtifact by looking up the given name in the manifest file(s).

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.EnsureSetupUnpack
member.summary: Ensures this StevedoreArtifact has been unpacked in the current backend. This method is useful in tests, and is not needed in normal usage.

member.name: M:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreArtifact.UnpackToUnusualLocation(NiceIO.NPath)
member.summary: Register artifact (with Backend.Current) for unpacking directly into a custom location in the "build" or "artifacts" folders. Returns the path to the version file that other build actions may reference as an input, in lieu of individual artifact files.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreSettings
member.summary: Settings that affect creation of StevedoreArtifacts for a specific backend. A new settings instance can be assigned to a Backend.Current.Steve.Settings;

member.name: P:Bee.Core.Stevedore.StevedoreSettings.EnforceManifest
member.summary: Whether to refuse downloads of artifacts not listed in manifest.

member.name: T:Bee.Core.Stevedore.SteveVirtualFileSystem
member.summary: SteveVirtualFileSystem is responsible for detecting virtual paths like described in the comments in StevedoreArtifact.cs

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit
member.summary: Enables use of init properties prior to .net5. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/proposals/csharp-9.0/init#metadata-encoding
